other_tests.findings: The thyroid gland is enlarged, with a heterogeneously hypoattenuating mass in the isthmus with multiple punctate calcifications. There is no pericardial effusion. There are trace bilateral pleural effusions. Mild biapical pleural parenchymal scarring and minimal cylindrical bronchiectasis in the right middle and upper lobes are noted.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Limited views of the upper abdomen are notable for peripancreatic stranding, consistent with history of pancreatitis, and unchanged from CT of the abdomen from previous day.
